inn1.comm: good length first up and a good line too just outside off, a hint of shape away from Amla who lets it go through to the keeper
Amla drives at a fuller ball outside off and plays towards point
short and wide outside off and Amla is away with a cut shot oozing confidence and authority. There was a third man but the ball steamed to the boundary before he could get to it
defended on the off side from the crease
short of a length and decent bounce through to the keeper after Amla lets it go
good length around off stump, Amla waits in his crease, gets behind the line, and blocks
Smith's away by pushing a wide delivery gently through the covers off the back foot
short ball on leg stump, Amla stays back, swivels and pulls the ball to the fine leg boundary
better length and the line is outside off this time, Amla lets it go
short of a length outside off, Amla tries to cut through point but mis-times it
good length around off stump, a hint of away movement, Amla is nicely behind the line to block
defended watchfully towards the off side
Bukhari slips a good length delivery past the outside edge of Smith's tentative forward defense
Smith gets a thick outside edge between the slips and point for a single
this one nips back in a touch from outside off, cramping Amla for room as he tries to force the ball on the off side
Amla flicks this one - fuller and straighter - through the gap at midwicket, won't go for four though
short of a length outside off, Amla goes back and cuts with a flourish towards third man
good length and rather straight. Smith comes forward and punches towards mid-on
a full ball on off stump, a half-volley in fact, Amla leans forward and drives, in the air a touch but placed safely into the gap between cover and mid-off
too straight now and Amla flicks the ball off his pads towards deep square
good length delivery pitching around off and slanting across the left-hander. Smith strides forward and lets it go
Smith tries to pull a short ball but is too early on the shot and mis-hits it towards fine leg. He runs hard and returns for the second
too full on the pads and Smith will hit that in his sleep, flicked through square but again the ball doesn't reach the boundary
full ball outside off stump, Amla stays back and digs it out towards point
good length and in line with the stumps, keeping Smith in his crease. Smith defends towards the bowler
width offered outside off stump, Smith stays in his crease and cuts towards wide third man
shorter length and Amla tries to pull but mis-times it, he's placed it into the gap at midwicket though so will get runs
good length just outside off stump, Smith shoulders arms
Smith moves forward and nudges a short of a length delivery off his hips towards square leg
shorter in length and wider outside off, Smith cuts the ball hard towards point but finds the fielder
played back to the bowler
Amla drives the ball firmly towards the bowler who gets some hand on it before it hits the stumps at the non-striker's end. Smith's bat was firmly grounded in safety.
short and wide and Amla tried to bash the ball through cover. He tried to hit it too hard and was early on the shot. The ball was in the air but bounced just in front of the fielder at cover.
steered towards third man for a single
full ball outside off stump, Smith plays the cover drive but the ball hits the bottom of his bat and goes nowhere
another full ball but straighter, Smith stays in his crease and pushes the ball towards point

edged and taken? Amla began to walk but the umpires are conferring about something, it was a low catch from the keeper Wesley Barresi. It was the slower ball and Amla's cut took the bottom edge through to Barresi, who stooped forward to take the catch. Replays show it might have just kissed the ground before it entered the gloves. Amla survives. The wicketkeeper wasn't sure either.
left alone outside off stump
Amla tries to whip it off his pads but doesn't make contact
good length outside off stump, Amla calmly lets it go outside off
Amla tries to drive through cover but the slower ball around off stump takes the outside edge through gully towards third man
beaten outside off stump, Smith prods off the front foot and connects with nothing
a very low full toss, Amla comes forward to push down the ground but the ball clunks into the bottom of his bat
worked off the pads towards square leg
Smith takes one and then another step down and drives a length ball through the gap at cover, perhaps his first really fluent shot of the day
short of a length on middle stump, Smith stays back this time and flicks the ball through square
too wide outside off, will have to do that one again
short ball but one that doesn't rise much, Amla swivels and pulls to deep backward square where a fine effort saves the boundary
punched off the back foot towards the bowler
short of a length and straight, Smith comes out of his crease to work the ball on the leg side but misses and gets hit on the thigh
fuller ball on middle and off, Smith stays in his crease, presses forward and plays the ball to the fielder at cover
Smith works a full ball through square leg for one

huge appeal for lbw as Amla presses forward and gets hit flush on the pad but a good length ball around off stump. The appeal is unsuccessful and the Dutch have asked for a review. That ball nipped into the righthander but struck Amla ever so marginally outside off stump. The decision stays.
defended with more certainty off the from foot towards cover
Amla moves forward and outside the line of off stump to create an angle that he can use to work a good length ball towards midwicket
angles his first ball into the right-hander, around off and middle, Amla stays back when he could have been forward, and dabs towards midwicket
Smith chops an attempted cut into the ground towards point, he didn't have much room. Amla had to sprint to complete the single
fuller ball on middle and leg, flicked towards long leg
slower ball outside off, a mis-timed drive from Smith and it's spooned in the air but wide of the man at short extra cover and short of the man at mid-off
full and wide, Smith chases with an ugly drive but misses. It was too wide
too straight this time and Smith turns the ball off his pads towards fine leg
a yorker to end the over, Amla keeps it out by playing it towards the bowler
Bukhari gets very close to the stumps and knocks the bails off as he delivers, Smith whips the ball off his pads through square
Amla moves forward and outside off to work the ball towards midwicket
pushed off the front foot towards mid-off
played off the front foot towards mid-on
good length just outside off stump, Smith waits and opens the face to run the ball towards third man
Amla uses this tactic again, gets outside the line of off stump, moves down the crease to work the ball from outside off through the leg side. Bukhari is going to have to make an adjustment
a full toss outside off stump, a low one. Amla drives but plays down the wrong line and gets beaten
played back to the bowler on the front foot
too full on leg stump, Amla flicks fluently towards deep square where the ball is picked up just inside the boundary
defended on the back foot towards the off side
Amla tries to drive through cover but the pace from ten Doeschate is slower and the inside edge ends up at midwicket
the ball nips back into Amla from outside off, he tried to play from the crease and got an inside edge on to the pad
the 50 comes up with a flick off the pads through square
Smith stays back and uses the angle into him from around the wicket to push the ball on the leg side
Loots is keeping it on off from around the wicket with the keeper standing up, Smith stays in his crease and plays on the off
Smith strides forward and defends a good length ball towards the bowler. Gentle medium pace on a tight line and length

bowled him! Smith stays in his crease and tries to force a good length ball angling into him from round the wicket on the leg side. He played across the line and missed completely, Loots hit leg stump and uprooted it.
length delivery outside off, Kallis lets it go through to Barresi
that's run down to the fine fine-leg boundary. Full and wide outside off, Amla reached out for it and inside-edged the drive past the wicketkeeper
driven on the off side from the crease
nudged off the pads towards midwicket
Kallis stays in his crease to a good length delivery angling into off and middle, he played with the angle towards midwicket
full ball on middle and leg, Kallis gets a thick inside edge towards long leg
a slower full toss and Amla simply pushes it towards midwicket
Kallis strides forward to play a powerful drive. Makes contact with air as Loots beats the outside edge
good length and the line is off and middle. Kallis gets on to the front foot and defends with a straight bat
he makes contact this time while playing the front-foot drive through cover but the fielder at point is in the way
another drive off the front foot, towards cover again. The fielder is in the way this time as well

oh dear me. Kallis is playing these drives with abandon and this one hits a thick inside edge and thuds into the pads. On another day that would have hit the stumps. Barresi leaps in excitement, and then frustration
Kallis waits on the back foot and cuts towards third man
played towards extra cover on the front foot
Kallis runs down the pitch to take the ball on the full and clips it firmly towards midwicket. Top shot but the fielder is in the way
edged and taken! A length ball down the leg side, one of ten Doeschate's worst balls today but Kallis' attempted glance results in a huge nick down the leg side. Barresi accepts the catch with glee.
good length ball on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length ball angling into middle, de Villiers pushes towards mid-on and sets off
too straight and Amla plays the ball off his pads through square
tight wicket-to-wicket line from Loots. Mark Elham would have been proud. Defended from the crease on the leg side
a bit of width this time and Amla uses it to cut towards third man
ouch that's a front-foot no-ball, de Villiers drilled it into the covers. He will be winding up for the free-hit
a slower ball outside off and de Villiers lays into hit and heaves down the ground. The ball falls straight into mid-on's hands but it can't be out of course
Amla stays deep in his crease and dabs the ball fine towards third man
Loots angles the ball into off from a good length and Amla pushes forward and guides towards third man
de Villiers goes on the back foot and punches a length ball through cover point
pitched up, a slower one, driven straight to mid-off
pitched up again, much straighter this time and is dealt with, driven sweetly between mid-on and midwicket for a lovely boundary
ten Doeschate offers him some width this time, it's short and wide and he cuts it fiercely, over point for four more
targeting the blockhole there was ten Doeschate, AB dug it out wide of point for a single
overpitched outside off, flayed through the covers this time into the deep for just a single
short of a good length on the off, dabbed with an open face towards third man for a single
a bit of width there, Ab reaches for it, opens the face and steers it wide of third man for a well-run couple
short of a good length outside off, crunched off the back foot towards point
slightly short outside off, no trouble running it down to third man for a single
lands on a good length, Amla decides to free his arms and crash that through cover, gets an inside edge onto his shoe
just short of a good length, Amla gets back and punches it well but straight to mid-off
angling in towards middle and leg from round the wicket, nudged away past square leg for a single
short outside off, gets back and slaps it hard down towards deep cover
gave it some air this time, flighted, bowled full on middle, driven down to long-on
rocks forward and eases it past the bowler to long-off for one more
bowling it on a length, deep cover into the act as it's driven through the in-field
easily negotiated, not much sign of turn so far, was flighted, landed in the zone and was driven down to long-off

ooh, Amla was in a bit of trouble there, went way across presumably with the intention of clearing midwicket, but it didn't come onto him as quick as he expected, ended up getting a leading edge that didn't carry
bowled full on the off, punched back towards the bowler
sees a bit of width and guides it down to third man for a single
goodish length on the off, gets forward, opens the face and guides it behind point
short ball outside off, chopped towards point, didn't time it well
bowled short again, Amla swats that firmly in front of square, deep cover has to run across and drags it back in but not before Amla has run three
he'll feel he missed out there, looped it up, was a low full toss, driven straight to extra cover
pitched up, cracked past extra cover into the deep for a single
went with the arm, on middle and off, gets forward and defends it with bat close to pad
fullish outside off, steered in the direction of point
Amla raises another half-century, comes down the track and drives it past midwicket for a single, a patient yet solid innings, it's that kind of pitch but he's adapted well
shortish outside off, chops it towards point, no run on offer this time
around a good length on the off, gets forward and drops it towards cover
in that channel outside off, pretty accurate stuff, guided to third man
short of a good length, plenty of open spaces in the field, pushed towards deep cover
shortish on middle, whipped away off the back foot to deep square leg for one more
sweet sound of bat hitting ball, pitched up and it's drilled towards deep cover, there is a fielder in the deep so no damage done but it brings up the 100
around a short of a good length, AB stands tall and strikes it back to Loots
down the track, gets to the pitch and drives it past cover
punched from the crease into the deep on the off side
lands full on middle, pushed back firmly but to the bowler
bowled flat and short outside off, crunched towards point, can't pierce the field
floated up on the off, comes down the track, tries to work it away square, can't beat the field again
A misfield by the captain allows them to take a single, punched off the back foot to extra cover, would have been another dot ball had it not been for that lapse
tries to force that through the off side, the right ball picked, length outside off, was eyeing extra cover, but not for the first time in the innings he got an inside edge onto his pads

gets it right this time but is helped by another misfield, this time at mid-off, driven hard off the front foot, was an almost indentical delivery but the execution was better this time, three more as Bukhari can't quite get his body behind it
short of a good length on the off, crunched off the back foot past cover
full and wide, Amla chases it and gets it to deep cover, raises the 50 stand, Netherlands need a breakthrough
in the corridor, AB gets across the line and defends with bat close to pad
angling in towards middle, got well across did AB, took it from a length and just pushed it down to mid-on
Seelar doesn't really turn it much, does he? Short and straight on the off, punched to deep cover
gave it plenty of air this time, driven to deep cover for one more
tempted to come down the track, gets to the pitch and smacks it towards long-off
full toss on middle, driven down towards long-on for one more, they're rotating the strike with ease here
short ball on middle, pulled a little awkwardly towards deep midwicket for a single
flighted on the off, cracked through the covers for one more
short of a good length outside off, cracked towards point
short outside off and de Villiers seizes the opportunity, stays rooted to his crease but adjusts well to the length, bends down and jabs it between mid-on and midwicket
slightly short outside off, cracked to point from the crease
good length on the off, presents the full face and drives it to long-off
tight line just a fraction outside off, pushed through point and cover
floating it just outside off, bends low and caresses it through the covers
on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
short on middle and off, bends low and slaps it ferociously, there is a big gao between deep midwicket and long-on and he bisects it, powerfully struck
full toss this time and he misses out, hits it well but straight to extra cover
eased through cover and point to retain the strike, Seelar not making much of an impact for Netherlands here

AB's innovative side on show now, was pitched full outside off and he had eyed his spot, short third man was in place and he just used the pace to reverse-paddle it past that fielder for four more, fluent innings this, carefree and chanceless
pushed down the ground to long-on for a single
a waist-high full toss from Cooper, Amla pulls it hard but straight to deep midwicket
worked away through the leg side into the deep for a single
pitches it up on middle, driven down the ground to long-on for a single
tries to reverse-paddle again but doesn't quite execute it well enough, ends up dabbing it just wide of the keeper
starts with a ball down the leg side, it's glanced down to fine leg for a single
too wide, well down the leg side and the keeper has no chance, five runs gifted, a threatening partnership this

comes down the track again and he hurls it on the pads once more, tries to glance it down but doesn't seem to make contact, the bowler however thinks so. Not given a wide, so there was impact but it's not clear if it was the pads or the bat. The keeper fumbled it
pushed off the front foot towards cover
bangs it short on middle, pulls it away towards deep midwicket for a single, well struck but the field is spread out now
hurls it full on middle, pushed down the ground to long-on for one more
short ball on middle, it was an offcutter, kept a little low but he got his bat down in time, and closed the face slightly, to play it wide of square leg for a single

full toss and de Villiers square drives it wide of deep point for a couple to raise a half-century, nicely paced despite the slow pitch, littered with singles and twos and the occasional boundary, easily done
punched down the ground to long-on for a single
worked away past midwicket for a single
smashed, stepping it up now, came down the track to that flighted delivery and absolutely drilled it back past the bowler to beat long-on
pushed away gently to midwicket
comes down the track and plays it wide of long-on for a brace
good length on middle, stroked down the pitch, past the non-striker, to long-on
the offcutter, came back in from short of a length on the off, gets on the back foot and drops it down onto the pitch
slower one bowled full on the off, AB picked it and drove it to long-on
lovely batting, no use of force there, just used the pace to perfection, nipped back in, third man was a little wide, Amla just opened the face at the last moment to late-cut that to the boundary
slightly short on middle, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
slower ball that Amla picked up a little late, reached forward and pushed it down to long-on for a single
straight on middle, opens the face slightly and plays it wide of extra cover for a single
floating it on the off, pitched up, driven past point for a single
looping it on middle, long-on into the act again
flat, fired in a little quick on the off, driven elegantly to deep cover but one is all he'll get
short ball but not cashed in on by Amla, slapped straight to extra cover
short on the off, drags it wide of square leg for a single to keep strike
short of a good length on the off, punched towards extra cover
short and punished, runs flowing now, yawning gap between deep square leg and fine leg and the ball was just right to be dispatched in that area
lands on a good length, driven on the up towards deep cover for a single
slower one bowled full on the off, pushed down the ground to long-on for a single
short of a good length, dabs it down to third man for a single
beautifully placed, he had made up his mind there, Wesdjik didn't help his cause by pitching short, again. All AB had to do was help it on its way past the short fine fielder
Amla waits in his crease for the ball to reach him and then drives towards long-off
shot. AB stands in his crease, makes a bit of room by moving his front foot out of the way and drives the ball powerfully through cover
a little slower, a little wider and AB tries to cover drive but gets beaten this time
short ball once again and AB swats it down to long on
played back to the bowler
Amla moves back and steers the ball through point
length ball outside off, Amla stands and drives, powerfully, but straight to the fielder at extra cover
driven off the front foot down the ground
a slower ball and AB checks his drive, ends up pushing it down the ground, past the bowler
wide outside off stump, Amla reaches out for it and dabs down to third man
AB doesn't spot the slower one and mis-times the ball back to the bowler, who fails to field it
played off the back foot towards point
Amla drills the drive back at ten Doeschate who bends low to field in his followthrough
shorter length and Amla waits in his crease before flicking the ball into the gap at deep backward square, it is fielded just inside the boundary
Amla uses the width outside off to cut a length ball towards third man
tight line and length on middle stump, AB stays firm in his crease and defends
de Villiers drives along the ground and just out of the reach of ten Doeschate who dives full length to his right
Amla waits for the ball to reach him and then taps it very late and gently towards third man
short and wide outside off stump, Amla flays at the ball but can't reach it. Wide called, marginal call
Amla goes on the back foot, waits until the ball is almost past him before dabbing it towards third man
pushed back towards the bowler on the front foot
AB stays so steady in his crease and then punches the ball late through covers
Amla leans on to the front foot and flicks the ball through square into the gap. AB absolutely hares back for the third
cut from the crease but the ball was on a good length and stayed a touch low so AB mis-timed it
dabbed towards third man for a single
full toss and that's a rather tame way to play it! A gentle push towards long-on for a single
full ball on off stump, driven firmly off the front foot towards long-off
guided towards third man off the front foot
that's really really slow outside off, AB waits and dabs, towards third man
dabbed towards the leg side for a non-existent single made existent
played towards mid-off

Amla comes forward and moves outside off to try and play the ball on the leg side. He's used this tactic against Bukhari in his earlier spell. This ball skidded through and beat Amla. It beat the keeper as well.
pushed towards mid-off where a fumble allows the single
played behind point for a single
and he gets to eighth one-day hundred with a relaxed dab towards third man. The celebrations begin and end rather quickly. Amla the run machine rolls on ...
played into the covers for a single
played towards third man for another single
Amla moves forward and opens the face to play the ball towards third man
played off the pads towards the fielder behind square but in the circle
driven off the front foot on to the player on the cover boundary
tight length but the line is on middle and leg. Played on the leg side
full ball on off and middle stump, driven firmly but to the fielder at cover
driven back to the bowler
played back to the bowler, Seelar does well to field it towards his right
bowled flat and fast, Amla tries to pull but misses and gets hit on the pad

shot! The innings' first six. AB pulls off the bluff. He moves outside leg a little to make room, making Seelar follow him. Seelar fires it down leg side and then AB moves towards off, getting inside the line, and hoists it over the fine leg boundary
launched towards the cover boundary this time, off the back foot. Top shot.
played on the leg side for one
Amla's turn. He goes inside out, making room by moving towards leg, and lofts the ball towards the cover boundary
AB moves outside leg, Bukhari cramps him for room by following the batsman. AB pushes down the ground
the yorker. Amla digs it out towards mid-off and calls for a quick single. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end but Amla's safe.
de Villiers tries to drive but gets beaten outside off
another yorker, well nearly,  and de Villiers jams it out towards point and that's terrific timing for a jam. The fielder at point mis-fields to allow the boundary
another yorker. Dug out to the bowler, no mis-fielding this time
full toss and AB brings up another hundred in the World Cup with a punch towards long-on. His top form continues.
AB goes big, and that's rather big. Down on one knee, big back lift, powerful swing and the ball disappears over the midwicket boundary
AB goes big again, and it's rather big again. He gets under a length ball and hammers it high and straight. the fielder on the long on boundary thinks he has a chance. He doesn't.
a third six! Shades of Gibbs in St. Kitts? Massively pulled over the deep midwicket boundary. Will he go for it?
can't hit a yorker for six. Loots does well and AB nudges it on the off side
Amla sees mid-off up and he plays it slightly inside out, scooping the ball over the fielder. One-bounce four to long-off
played off the pads through square
AB goes down on one knee, waits for the length ball and turns his head away as he executes the reverse shot, not a sweep, over the head of short third man
short and wide outside off and AB carves it over cover point, easy as you please
length ball, mid-off is up because a fielder went deep on the square boundary. AB stands in his crease and lofts the ball cleanly over mid-off.
a full toss, and AB drives towards long-on
caught! Amla makes room to dispatch a length ball through the off side. He was cramped for room and ended up slicing the ball towards point, where the fielder took a simple catch
full ball, punched off the front foot towards mid-off
good length ball cramping the right-hander as he moves outside leg a touch, driven towards long-on for one
full ball on the pads, nudged through midwicket for one more
makes room but mis-times the drive towards mid-off

full ball in the blockhole, dug out towards long-on. There's an easy single on offer but hang on, they want a double. AB is in trouble here as he sprints back and dives full length. The throw from the deep is good and the bowler breaks the stumps with AB well short
nudged off the pads for a single
a full toss outside leg stump, the keeper does well to get some glove on it
comes forward and pushes the ball towards long on for a single
flighted ball outside off, driven off the front foot through cover
pushed off the front foot towards cover point for a single
the reverse paddle ,and the placement is so fine and the touch so deft that the ball races to the third man boundary
worked off the pads towards midwicket
played off the back foot towards long-on and they want the second again. The throw is at Duminy's end and his dive is effective
that's far too wide outside off, Duminy tried to sweep that and had no chance. The keeper was standing up and he had no chance either
Dumny makes room and drives the ball fluently towards cover where the fielder does well to get a hand on it
deft and clever. du Plessis came down the pitch, hoping to attack, the ball was slower and so he had to readjust. He opened the face and guided it fine to the third man boundary
pushed toward cover for a quick single
he's teed off with spectacular results. Length delivery from Westdjik and Duminy pounces, lofting the ball extremely far over the long-on boundary with a massive swing of the bat
wide outside off stump, will have to re-bowl that one
short ball and Duminy misses the hook and gets struck on the helmet. He's not flustered though and manages to take three from a blow to the head!
nudged towards point off the front foot, 22 runs off that over
flicked off the back foot towards long on
Duminy changes, gets under the ball and sends it over the midwicket boundary, he hit that with the turn into him and made clean contact
Duminy makes room to pull but misses and gets hit on the body
a short ball and Faf makes room and waits, with bat high in the air. The ball keeps low after pitching though and he has to adjust quickly to play through midwicket
flicked towards deep backward square
Duminy got into position to play the reverse whack too early and the bowler bowled an extremely slow ball. Duminy had to wait ages to hit it and then mis-timed it to short third man
Duminy throws his bat at a wide delivery outside off and slices it high in the air towards the man on the point boundary. The ball falls safely
length ball on the pads and Duminy flicks it with power towards the deep backward square boundary. That bounced only once before going over
this one has gone all the way. Length ball and Duminy clears his front foot to make room and sends it sailing over the straight boundary
incredible shot. A mere punch on the up to a length delivery and the timing is so terrific that it carries over the boundary
the blitz from Duminy ends. Another length ball, poor bowling, but Duminy pulls and makes contact with the bottom of his bat. He picks out the fielder on the deep midwicket boundary.
another length ball to end the over and du Plessis pulls towards deep midwicket and challenge the fielder by taking a second.

inn2.comm: short of a good length on middle, gets on the back foot and defends it onto the leg side
around middle and off, just a hint of away movement, gets forward and taps it into the off side
some swing for Steyn this time, landed on middle and deviating away, pushed slightly uppishly back down the pitch
short of a good length on middle and off, gets on the back foot and defends it to cover
banged in short on middle, ducks under it easily
goodish length just outside off, gets forward and defends it solidly in front of cover
good carry to the keeper first up, around a good length just outside off, shoulders arms to the keeper
nips back in this time, shortish and wasn't far from the off stump as he let it through
back of a length on middle, is nicely behind it this time, solidly defended back towards the bowler
much fuller, on a length on the off stump, pushed through towards cover
short ball but misdirected, stays down the leg side and gifts Netherlands their first run
edged and four, full outside off, tempts Baressi into playing the drive, he gets a thick outside edge well beyond the reach of second slip for a boundary
swing there for Styen and produces the leading edge, the batsman failed to spot it, closed the face too early and it moved away late, that's his most lethal delivery
short of a good length outside off, some width this time, crunched towards point
short down the leg side, misdirected again, another wide
down the leg side and it's dealt with this time, juicy delivery on the pads and he glances it with ease to the fine-leg boundary
short of a length outside off, he sways away from it no worries
short ball down the leg side again, the third such wide this innings
gave himself room there to smack him through the off side but there was a change of pace from the bowler, the slower one beat the early swing of the bat
beautifully driven, pitched up and he latched on, got forward to the pitch and caressed it through cover
short of a good length outside off, shoulders arms to let it through
a touch fuller but enough width there for him to ignore, no swing for Morkel, he's more hit the deck
angling in towards off, tries to defend it with a full face but ends up getting a thick inside edge past square leg
pushing it fuller, lands on a length, pushed firmly towards mid-off
back of a length on the off, knocks it down off the front foot, solidly done
targeting middle, around a good length, drops it wide of midwicket for a quick single
fullish on the pads, flicked uppishly through square leg for a couple of runs in the deep
the swing almost had him there, on middle and off and moved away, the batsman had closed the face too early and was almost trapped in front, was fortunate to get a leading edge
banged in short outside off, dragged wide of midwicket, Imran Tahir chases it down, dives and hauls it back in, but three more
slower one bowled on a length on middle, flicked away through square leg for three more, fine leg runs across and cuts it off
short ball and he again attempts to pull it but this time it';s struck straight to mid-on

not Kervezee for sure, Kallis strikes first ball, was on a length on middle and off and Kervezee just went through with an attempted straight drive, striking it straight back to Kallis who clasped it on the second attempt
short of a good length on the off, gets on the back foot and taps it into the off side
angling it towards middle, Cooper tries to drive through straight but does so slightly inside the line, rolls down to third man
cut back in from a good length outside off, Barresi covered it well, getting behind the line and defending it to extra cover
straying on the pads, seemed to nip in from middle, tried to clip it square but was struck on the pads, would have gone down leg
short of a length and he doesn't waste the chance, gets forward and just eases it into that gap between cover and point for a boundary
targeting middle was Steyn, Cooper moved well across and flicked it to square leg
pitched up and he deals with it, stepping forward and driving it through extra cover, raced away
full on middle, presents the full face while driving it down to mid-on
fullish outside off, pushed gently towards extra cover, a hint of away swing
banged in short outside off, an atempted bouncer, Cooper backs away from it
slower ball and Cooper didn't seem to pick it there, flicked it uppishly and it got to square leg on the bounce
full on the off stump, gets forward and pushes it down to midwicket
slightly short of a good length on the off, rocks on the back foot and punches it down to mid-on
fullish on middle and leg, gets forward, closes the face and nudges it in front of short fine leg for a single
a belated hook that, was really late on that shot, was initially trying to evade it but then played at it, got it down to deep square leg
slightly short outside off, looking to punch it towards extra cover, gets a thick outside edge down to third man
played that one nicely, rose up to him at around chest height but he took the bottom hand off and opened the face to guide it to third man
back of a length outside off, nipping in slightly, shoulders arms to leave it be
draws him forward with a good length delivery, defends slightly outside the line, gets a thick inside edge past square leg for a single
steps forward and taps it in the direction of cover
short of a good length on middle, gets on the back foot and knocks it down in front of midwicket
not the first time that Kallis has produced an edge off Cooper's bat, pushing at it inside the line is the batsman, a run to third man
banged it short on the off, seized the length early and pulled it past midwicket, there is a deep square leg in place and Peterson there managed to cut it off with a slide, two more
short of a good length on the off, punched off the back foot to mid-off

dropped, one of the easiest catches of all time, Morne Morkel has made a mess of it, short outside off and Barresi went for the pull, it came to him a touch too quickly, he got a top edge and there was Morne waiting for it at mid-on, was in perfect position to take it, seemed confident enough to clasp it but it slipped through his fingers, he's shocked, so is everyone else around him
played down towards third man for a single
length ball from Morne, outside the off stump, steps forward and pushes it to point
short of a good length, rocks back and taps it down towards point
hitting the pitch hard is Morne, slightly short on the off, defended with a closed face into the leg side
short of a length outside off, chopped down towards point
point has been pushed back, punched off the back foot towards the fielder in the deep for a single
good length outside off, wrong length to cut but he tries to do just that, fails to connect
good length on middle, turned away through square leg into the deep for a single
short of a good length on middle and off, defended solidly towards cover
slower one bowled full on middle, pushed down towards mid-on
was trying to force that one through the off side, it nipped back in to take the inside edge, albeit a thick one

Steyn proves he's a better catcher than Morkel, thatr was judged very well, short ball from Kallis and Cooper went for the pull, bounced higher than he expected, got a top edge and Steyn running a few yards to his right from fine leg took it in front of his face and retained his balance
good length on the off, gets forward and plays it towards extra cover
quick single, fullish on middle, dropped in front of mid-off, races off for a single, Kallis attempts a throw at the striker's end but doesn't strike, would have been out had that hit
short and wide and he slashes hard, there's only one slip in place, flies of fthe edge to the third-man boundary
bowled it short on middle, tucked away behind square for a single
back of a length on the off, coming back in, plays it with soft hands into the off side
bowled it short on the off, dropped in front of cover, thought of a single did Zuiderent but it's not there
bangs it short on middle, Zuiderent was in the firing line there, took his eyes off the ball for an instant there but managed to fend it off with his left hand
short of a good length outside off, nipping back in but only just, shoulders arms
kept a little low this time, the length was similar but he attempted a cut that he failed to connect because of the low bounce
dropped it shorter this time, on top of that one was Barresi and knocked it down towards cover
shortish on middle, gets on the back foot and works it away through square leg for a single

Referral, moved back in sharply and appeared to strike Zuiderent in line, he was only half forward there though the only question I guess is the height. Pitched outside off and nipped in big time, it's not just the height. Replays show there was an inside edge, Asoka de Silva gave it out, Zuiderent called for a referral and replays confirmed he was not out. The decision has been reversed
in the channel outside off, knocked past cover, tries to squeeze the infield but cant get it past the 30-yard circle
slightly short on middle, patted away towards deep square leg for a single
slightly short on leg stump, doesn't turn, lobs up off the pads and Morne van Wyk makes a valiant attempt but there was no contact with the bat there
fullish on middle, driven back to the bowler
closes the face this time to play it through square leg for a single
the googly, gets a big stride out to defend, he didn't pick it, spun back in to rap him on the pads but it would have been going down
googly again which he again doesn't pick, shorter in length and he was suddenly cramped for room as it turned back in just as he was trying to play the cut
short of a good length, nipping back in, knocked  down in front of cover
short of a length outside off, tried to nudge it down to third man, looking to play it late but makes no contact
short and wide, this time Zuiderent tries to clear point, there to cut but again he makes no contact
full and wide, Zuiderent sensed a chance and tried to cream that through the covers, got a thick outside edge to the third-man boundary, got what he had originally wanted off that ball
back of a length on middle, gets on the back foot and knocks it down on the pitch
drops it in front of point, back of a length again from Kallis, safely negotiated
played to square leg
tossed up on middle and the batsman unfurls the sweep and makes solid contact, sending the ball racing to the fine-leg boundary
defended on the off side
pushed towards mid-on
turned off the pads towards square
quicker ball on off, defended on the front foot
no room outside off stump, the attempted cut is chopped into the ground
played out to deep square
defended solidly off the front foot
Zuiderant moves forward and pushes towards cover point
defended on the leg side
flighted ball on off stump, driven off the front foot towards long-off
defended on the back foot towards mid-on
full ball on middle, played off the toes towards midwicket
swept firmly towards deep square leg
blocked on the leg side once again
that's the googly and a quicker one. The batsman gets an inside edge on to the pad as he pushes forward
bowled slowly on middle and off, defended on the back foot
played with an open face towards point from the crease
makes room to cut but mis-times it on the off side
played down to long on for a single
Zuiderant charges, Zuiderant swings, and the ball flies off the edge over extra cover and falls safe. He was aiming for the leg side
nudged behind square on the leg side
played from the crease on the leg side
defended on the front foot, a thick outside edge goes towards short third man
swept towards fine leg
the batsman steps out and drives towards long off for a single
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Zuiderant gets down on one knee and slaps the ball towards deep square
there's an appeal for lbw but it's unsuccessful
Zuiderent charges, gets to the pitch of the ball and hoists the ball high and far over deep midwicket

lbw! Zuiderent lunged forward to defend, the ball came in with the arm from over the wicket and hit him low on the pad on the front foot. The impact was more than 2.5 meters from the stumps but Asoka de Silva said out and Zuiderent did not review it. That would have hit the stumps, in my opinion
nudged off the front foot towards square leg
ten Doeschate goes deep into his crease and works the ball through midwicket
dangerous, chopping the ball from off stump towards short third man
ten Doeschate goes deep into his crease and defends on the leg side
defended on the off side from the crease
a slow and low delivery, giving ten Doeschate lots of time to go back and play behind square

there's an appeal for a stumping and van Wyk is confident. Duminy, from round the wicket, slanted the ball across Barresi who pushed forward in defence. The ball sped past his outside edge and van Wyk whipped off the bails in a flash. Replays show that Barresi had dragged his foot out and only managed to get it back on the line before the bails were broken. On the line is not good enough, he has to go.
defended on the front foot towards the off side
pushed towards long on for a single
the batsman lunges forward and plays no shot and is hit on the pad. Tahir screams an appeal but Asoka says not out. No review is asked for. It was the googly.
Swept behind square for a single
played towards cover point for a single
plays the ball towards midwicket for a single
played on the off side for one more
played off the pads towards short fine leg
defended cautiously on the front foot towards the bowler
turned off the pads through square
a quicker and fuller ball on middle, played back to the bowler
pitches outside leg and continues down leg side, wide called
comes on to the front foot and nudges towards square for a single
played towards the bowler on the front foot
defended on the off side
fuller ball on off stump, driven off the front foot towards long off for a single
the reverse sweep and he's picked out the gap behind point but the timing's not good enough for it to each the boundary
quicker and flatter ball, defended on the off side from the crease
fuller delivery on off and middle, pushed towards cover
quicker ball, nearly in the blockhole, the batsman just manages to dig it out
slower flighted delivery on middle, defended on the front foot towards the off side
de Grooth moves forward and turns the ball off his pads through square
pushed off the front foot towards cover
pitches outside leg from round the wicket, worked off the pads to short fine leg
comes forward to get to the pitch of the ball and drive to mid-off
defended on the front foot towards midwicket but there's a gap there and a single for the taking
short and quicker delivery, played off the pads towards square
good length delivery outside off, cut off the back foot towards point, that wasn't timed well
Steyn brings the ball back into the right-hander and he taps it through square leg
full ball outside off stump, driven off the front foot towards cover
bouncer, left alone by the batsman

massive appeal for lbw from Steyn, and after an age Asoka raises the finger to send ten Doeschate on his way. Steyn pitched the ball outside off and cut it into the right-hander. ten Doeschate was beaten for pace and was late in bringing his bat down. The ball thudded into the pad first and that's plumb
played towards third man for a single to get off the mark right away
defended on the leg side off the front foot
Duminy is keeping it tight, wicket to wicket, pushed towards the leg side
played behind point off the front foot
driven down towards long-on for a single
the batsman takes two steps down the pitch and defends after realising he's far away from the pitch of the ball
played from the crease towards midwicket
Steyn hits a good length and angles it into the right-hander, striking Peter Borren on the pad, no appeal this time
Borren pushes forward in defence to a good length delivery on off and middle. Netherlands have shut shop, they shut shop a while ago
the forward defence again, but the ball ends up behind square off the inside edge
full ball but the line is outside leg and van Wyk flies across to his left to catch the ball
short of a length outside off, played off the back foot towards point
good length and straight, defended on the back foot towards the bowler
a full ball on middle and leg, nearly a yorker, played through midwicket
two steps down the pitch and a flat hit through wide mid-on, the fielder on the long on boundary prevents the four
defended on the off side
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
played off the pads towards square leg
nudged off the front foot towards the leg side. Faf swoops on the ball in a flash and prevents the single
two steps down the pitch again but this time the batsman has to defend
played off the back foot behind square
defended on the leg side
punched off the front foot but Peterson dives to his right to prevent runs

there's another appeal for lbw which leaves Asoka unmoved and Smith wants a review. Not a no-ball. The ball pitched in line with the stumps and straightened. Borren planted his foot forward, tried to play across the line, and got hit on the pad. Replays show it was hitting the middle of middle, or thereabouts. Asoka has to change his decision.
defended with a straight bat towards the bowler, not very convincing
Bukhari aims for the leg side and brings out the mighty heave-sweep, and misses

a direct hit at the non-striker's end and de Grooth is run out. He nudged the ball off his pads towards the leg side and the fielder at square leg swooped on the ball and unleashed a deadly accurate throw. de Grooth was just short. Smith was the fielder I think.
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
fired down leg side. van Wyk makes a sharp take and whips off the bails
cleaned up by the googly. Bukhari swung at the ball with a rather large gap between bat and pad. Tahir pitched the googly on a length and spun it through that yawning gap.
Tahir fires that down the leg side and it's called a wide
the google again, struck on the pads and he clearly didn't pick it but the impact was outside the line
turning away, gets forward and taps it into the off side
sharp turn into the batsman from outside off, the googly again, impact though was again outside the line
shortish on middle and off, punched away to extra cover
tossed up, lands full on the off, pushed to extra cover
short and flat outside off, slapped towards extra cover, there's an overthrow and they take a run
lands on a length on the off, gets a big stride forward and defends into the off side
bowled way down the leg side, called a wide
getting a big stride out and is struck on the pad, he's hiding his bat behind it, but that wasn't hitting the stumps
something to cheer for the Dutch, finally, tossed up and he lofts it straight over the bowler's head for a clean six, well struck
short of a good length outside off, turning away, leaves it alone
the googly, fullish on the off, knocks it past midwicket for a single

was that the flipper? Seemed like it, short on middle and skidded on, he just didn't have a clue, was caught on the back foot and rapped on the pads right in front of middle. He's called for a referral but replays show there was no impact with the bat and that he was dead plumb
appeal for lbw yes, theyve called for a review as Tahir raps the batsman on the pads, the umpire gave it not out and was upheld as replays indicate the batsman was struck outside the line

It's all over for Netherlands, Tahir slipped that one in quicker, around middle and off, and it appeared to go straight on, the batsman stepped forward, tried to close the face and missed and was struck in line. The umpire gave it out, but a referral was called for by Netherlands. As it turned, replays only confirmed he was gone
